page.title: 13Yetholm Farms
page.content: The hill country, covered with lush green pasturage is ideally suited for sheep farming, cattle rearing and associated crop production. The seven farms in this block generaly practice mixed farming using modern machinery and methods. Soil conditions, climate, impose limits within which farming can be developed although increased use of fertilizers is common. Breeds of sheep include Gray face, South Country Cheviots and over 60 Dorset Downs at Lochtower kept for thier thick wool and quality meat. Small herds of cattle are kept on the majority of farms. Lochside, a dairy farm has over 235 friesans. 2,500 litres of milk are produced a day from this 311 acre farm. Land is now being converted to crop productions because of EEC milk quotas. A rare breed of cow the British White is kept for intrest.
